January 31, 1953
NAEB Advisory Committee's TV Program Meeting
1, Planning and
management: NAEB Advisory Committee to the Educational
Television and Radio Program Center
(Paulu, chairman; Ausmus; Hull; McCarty; Probst)
2, Place:
Allerton House or the Kellogg Center
3* Time:
Early spring, 1953
kÂ» Length:
Six to eight days
5* Financing?
The $5,000 grant already appropriated to the NAEB for a seminar
(Additional funds, if necessary, from the NAEB-Kellogg project)
6. Selection of institutions to be represented and of individual participants:
The NAEB Advisory Committee, augmented by Ralph Steetle of JCET
7* Criteria of selection:
(a) Educational institutions and combinations of educational
institutions in a given area that will be prepared by the
end of 1953 to produce television programs and record them
on film (standard or kine) for distribution through the
Center;
(b) The person (sometimes two persons) in each qualifying
institution who is, or will be, responsible for television
program development, (Not necessarily a radio or television
station manager or the head" of motion picture work;
emphasis in selection on the creative program man rather
than on administrative rank where the two are separate),
8* Agenda: Responsibility of the Paulu Committee
9. Consultants: (As needed) To be selected by the Paulu Committee
